definition: to pluck (a string)/to play (a string instrument)/to spring or leap/to shoot (e.g. with a catapult)/(of cotton) to fluff or tease/to flick/to flip/to accuse/to impeach/elastic (of materials)

sentences.english: Not one person in my squad got out without a bullet round.
sentences.chinese: 我的小隊中沒有人出去身上不帶彈孔回來的。

sentences.english: For larger calibers, mix a pasteof equal parts starch and salt.
sentences.chinese: 彈孔再大的話，就用等量的澱粉和鹽和成糊往上抹。

sentences.english: He enters the transformer room and finds Teri with bullet wounds in her abdomen.
sentences.chinese: 他進入了配電房，發現了泰瑞，她的腹部有幾個彈孔。

sentences.english: The TV also showed images of several water-filled craters caused by the blasts.
sentences.chinese: 電視還播放了一些填滿水的被炸彈炸穿的彈孔的畫面。

sentences.english: I see bullet points in my head. I number everything.
sentences.chinese: 看到我頭上的彈孔，我也會一一編號。

sentences.english: Ask me what’s the fastest way to hide bullet holes ina living-room wall.
sentences.chinese: 還知道把起居室牆上的彈孔藏起來的快招。

sentences.english: But he couldn't find a bullethole.
sentences.chinese: 但是他並沒有找到彈孔。

sentences.english: Nearly everyone in First Platoon had a bullet hole in his vest or helmet.
sentences.chinese: 一排幾乎所有人的護胸和盔甲上都有個彈孔的痕跡。

definition: extraordinary strength/super strong/strong as an ox
to attack with a bladed weapon
without a retreat route/caught in a dead end/having burned one's bridges
